    • Method Detail

      • addForecourtEventListener

        public void addForecourtEventListener(Forecourt.ForecourtEventListener eventListener)

      • broadcastMessage

        public void broadcastMessage(int terminalId,
                    int notificationId,
                    java.lang.String notificationString,
                    int wait)
                      throws EnablerException
        This method allows client applications to alert other connected clients of custom events by passing an id and a string to all connected clients.
        Parameters:
        terminalId - Number of terminal to broadcast to or -1 to broadcast to all terminals
        notificationId - Client specific ID to be passed to clients
        notificationString - Client specific string to be passed to clients
        wait - Number of milliseconds to wait for ACK (only for single terminal destinations)
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String serverAddress,
           int terminalId,
           java.lang.String terminalName,
           java.lang.String password,
           java.lang.Boolean active)
             throws EnablerException
        The method will create a apiConnection with the server and so it must be the first method called by an application to use the API.

        Note : To connect to the Pump Server the terminalId must be set to a non-zero, positive number (1,2,3 etc).

        Where multiple client applications are active, each must use a different terminalId. If a client tries to connect using an already active terminalId, the method will throw an exception with a return code TERMINAL_ID_ALREADY_LOGGED_ON_RESULT.

        This method will fail if the Pump Server is not available.

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - Address of server to connect to. This can either be the host name or an IP address.
        terminalId - A number to identify the client application.
        terminalName - A name to identify the client application. Can be an empty string or null.
        password - Password associated with terminalId in Enabler Configuration.
        active - This is set to true if the terminalId is monitored for automatic fall back when all active terminals are off line.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - to indicate the reason the operation failed.

      • connectAsync

        public void connectAsync(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                int terminalId,
                java.lang.String terminalName,
                java.lang.String password,
                java.lang.Boolean active)

        This method begins an asynchronous connection/login operation with the server.

        Note : To connect to the Pump Server the terminalId must be set to a non-zero, positive number (1,2,3 etc).

        Where multiple client applications are active, each must use a different terminalId. If a client tries to connect with the same terminalId as another application, the result will be a return code of TERMINAL_ID_ALREADY_LOGGED_ON_RESULT.

        This method will start the connection operation and return immediately back to the caller. When the operation completes the Forecourt.ForecourtEventListener.onConnectAsyncResultEvent(itl.enabler.api.events.forecourt.ConnectCompletedEventArgs) will be fired with the operation result.

        • Success is indicated by OK.
        • The method will fail if the Pump Server is not available.

        This method should be used to ensure the calling thread (e.g. GUI) can continue to execute during the connect operation.

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - Address of server to connect to - either hostname or IP address.
        terminalId - A number to identify the client application.
        terminalName - A name to identify the client application. Can be an empty string or null.
        password - Password associated with terminalId in Enabler Configuration.
        active - This is set to true if the terminalId is monitored for automatic fall back when all active terminals are off line.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(java.lang.String message)
        This method allows client applications to disconnect from the Pump server

        Note : To disconnect from the Pump Server, the application must have previously called the Forecourt.connect method

        Parameters:
        message - Optional message that will be logged

                               throws EnablerException

        Returns:
        A Transaction object or null if not found
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • getTransactionByReference

        public Transaction getTransactionByReference(java.lang.String clientReference)
                                      throws EnablerException
        Returns a fuel transaction using the Transaction Client reference

        Note : If multiple transactions have the same reference it will return the first transaction.

        Parameters:
        clientReference - A unique reference supplied by client
        Returns:
        A Transaction object or null if not found
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • getUPS

        public UPS getUPS()
        Returns the state of the UPS connected to the server, if any.

        The UPS state will be shown as unknown if no UPS is connected to server

        Returns:
        State of the UPS connected to the server (if any)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        connected state of the underlining apiConnection

      • isDebugMode

        public boolean isDebugMode()
        Returns:
        true if the debugMode flag is set

        Note : When set, this flag stops the apiConnection to the Enabler from timing out and disconnecting when debugging an application.

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal()
        Returns true if connected to a local server (on the same system as client).
        Returns:
        true if server is also the client.

      • isSecure

        public boolean isSecure()
        Returns true if the connection is secure.

        Note: Local connections are always non-SSL.

        Returns:
        true if the Enabler API connection to the Server is secure (SSL).

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange(ActionType actionType,
                DataType dataType,
                int dataId)
                  throws EnablerException
        This method is called to notify the pump server that the configuration has changed and needs to be reloaded or an external status has changed.

        Note : This method is provided primarily for the use of Configuration applications, but may be used by any application that updates tables in the Enabler database.

        Refer to The ENABLER Database Dictionary for a description of the database structure.

        Parameters:
        actionType - indicates what database action to perform
        dataType - For database changes this indicates which database table
        dataId - For database changes this indicates the ID field of the chosen database table
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • removeEventListener

        public void removeEventListener(Forecourt.ForecourtEventListener eventListener)

      • removeLocksAndReserve

        public void removeLocksAndReserve()
                           throws EnablerException
        Remove all Reserves and Locks that this terminal has applied.

        Note : This is used to tidy up after errors and should be called by the client application to remove all locks and reserves if it is closing down as a result of an error.

        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • setCurrentMode

        public void setCurrentMode(int modeId)
                    throws EnablerException
        Set the current mode of the site

        Changing the site mode will trigger mode changes on all pumps affected by the new site profile.

        Parameters:
        modeId - New site profile mode id.
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • setDebugMode

        public void setDebugMode(boolean debugMode)
        Runs the API in debug or normal mode.
        Parameters:
        debugMode - Run API in debug mode if true else run in normal mode

      • setPumpLights

        public void setPumpLights(boolean pumpLights)
                   throws EnablerException
        Set state of pump lights on the forecourt
        Parameters:
        pumpLights - true to set pump lights ON. false to set pump lights OFF
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • setTraceLevel

        public void setTraceLevel(Forecourt.LogLevel level)
        Sets the EnablerAPI TraceLevel.
        Parameters:
        level - LogLevel

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws EnablerException
        This methods allows clients to stop all installed pumps.

        Note : Stop is provided as an emergency stop for the forecourt, although industry regulations often also require a physical emergency stop button on the forecourt as well.

        Throws:
        EnablerException
